values:
1) Are you really ready for 101 questions?
nothing better to do at the moment.

2) Was your last kiss a mistake?
no.

3) Do you believe in God?
yes.

4) Who did you last say I love you to?
my husband.

5) Do you regret it?
no.

6) What's your favorite BBQ'd food?
steak.

7) Have a best friend?
yes.

(is 8 hiding?)

9) Are you eating?
not right now, but i haven't quit or anything..

10) How do you want to die?
not alone, preferrably not painfully.

11) What did you last eat?
jujubes.

12) Last call?
brother-in-law.

13) What cell phone service do you use?
tmobile.

14) Tom from MySpace is about to go to jail, what’s your first thought?
what for?

15) Do you have an attitude?
who me? no...

16) Ever wanna be in love?
always wanna be in love.

17) How much do you text?
i forgot what it was like before text..

18) Like reading?
love it.

19) Are you going to get high later?
no.

20) Do you hate anyone at the moment?
not that comes to mind.

21) Twirl, or cut your spaghetti?
twirl. the slurp.

22) Do you miss someone?
yes. lots of someones.

23) When was your last family reunion?
i don't have a clue. i was really really young.

24) Have any pets?
i think it's more than the limit.

25) How exactly are you feeling now?
tired, but not quite ready to sleep.

26) Ever ate food in a car while someone or yourself is driving?
yep.

27) Do you like someone?
yeah...

(where did 28 go??)

29) Favorite food?
depends on my mood.

30) Are Barbie & Ken bad influences on people?
uhhh...

31) Do you regret anything from your past?
i try not to focus on the past, it is what it is. can't change it. why regret what you can't change?

32) What are you listening to?
the clicking of the fan.

33) Do you want to have kids?
someday.

34) Ever kissed somebody with a name that starts with an E?
i don't know.

35) Do you type fast?
not really.

36) Any piercings?
i'm down to just the ear.

37) Want any more?
nope.

38) Tattoos?
yep.

39) What do you miss the most about your past?
amber.

40) What are you craving right now?
sleep.

(alright... this is ridiculous.. who took 41 and 42?!?!?)

43) Does somebody love you?
yes.

(who the hell counted this survey??!??!)

54) Ever been kicked out of a bar?
nope.


55) Do you have trust issues?
little bit, yeah.

56) Favorite song?
leaky lil boat.

(wheres fiddy seven?)

58) Where’s your favorite place to be?
cabin.

59) Do you like redbull?
blech.

60) Do you have a good relationship with your parents?
now more so than ever.

61) Are you secretly with somebody?
most of the time i'm not.

62) Do you believe your ex thinks about you?
I'm sure of it.

63) Do you like filling out these long surveys or is it because you're bored?
thats pretty much the only time i do them.

64) Have you ever betrayed a best friend?
yes.

(wtf? 65...66?)

67) What was the last movie you saw?
uhh.. i dunno.

68) Have you ever walked outside in the rain?
one of my favorite things..

69) Do you think you are a good person?
i try to be.

70) Do you believe everything happens for a reason?
i like to hope theres a greater purpose behind them.. otherwise it becomes difficult to get throught the day sometimes.

71) Do you like cheese?
yep.

72) What did you do last night?
hung out at home with the hubby. read a book. snuggled.

73) What does your mouse pad look like?
dont have one.

74) What brand of computer do you use?
the kind doug has in here.

75) Do you play the Wii?
dont have one.

76) How do you feel about Wal-Mart?
i hate going soooo bad.

77) Do you know where Tehran is?
should i?

78) Who has inspired you the most?
different people at different times.

79) Best pick up line?
not a pocket.

(here eightyeightyeighty..)

81) Are you mean?
only to poeple i like.

82) Can you keep white shoes clean?
i dont think i own white shoes.

83) Do you believe in true love?
yes.

84) Are you a lover or a fighter?
lover.

85) Are you proud of the person you've become?
mostly.

86) Who has helped you, or convinced you to change?
my parents, who have supported me through it all and never given up on me. my best friends, ditto.

87) Who was the last person to make you mad?
the hubby.

88) Do you like to be outside?
only when it's not hot.

89) Are you currently bored?
not as much as i was when i started this silly incomplete survey.

90) Do you want to get married?
twice is good for me. i hope this one lasts.

91) Ever failed a class?
yep.

92) How many different countries have you been to?
one, other than my home country.

93) Do you like celery?
yes. in fact, i think it should be regularly served at establishments such as ihop.

94) What makes you happy?
little things. lots of them.

95) What is your favorite name for a girl?
growing up i always wanted a daughter named Petra Paisley Ann. i have no idea why.

96) Do you like to party?
not really. i'm more of the quiet night at home kinda girl.

97) Are you paranoid?
should i be?

98) Do you watch the news?
not generally.

99) What is your zodiac sign?
pisces.

100) Do you like Subway?
eat fresh!

101) Who were the last five people you texted?
kat, doug, shan, not doug and shawn.

1. What did you do in 2004 that you'd never done before?
went straight to jail. did not pass go. did not collect $200.

2. Did you keep your new years' resolutions, and will you make more for next year?
i don't believe in resolutions. didn't make one last year, and won't make one again this year.

3. Did anyone close to you give birth?
no. but i know people who're gonna have babies soon.

4. Did anyone close to you die?
yes. in january, the soul closest to me, the one that truly understood me and gave me unconditional love and undivided attention.

5. What countries did you visit?
none. :( both mexico trips flopped.

6. What would you like to have in 2005 that you lacked in 2004?
stability. self respect. self love.

7. What dates from 2004 will remain etched upon your memory, and why?
january 9th - see #4.
june 18 - cvt exams.
august 24 - the day the nightmare became reality.

8. What was your biggest achievement of the year?
i passed my national and state certification exams. 

9. What was your biggest failure?
failing myself in the aspect of not loving myself enough to do what was best for me. 

10. Did you suffer illness or injury?
pneumonia. don't ever try for it. it sucks a lot. 

11. What was the best thing you bought?
i dunno. probably tacos.

12. Whose behavior merited celebration?
who the hell uses the word merit anymore other than the boy scouts?

13. Whose behavior made you appalled and depressed?
mine. his. hers.

14. What did you spend most of your spare cash on?
i dunno... probably tacos.

15. What did you get really, really, really excited about?
getting out and seeing family and friend again. being home again. being with my parents again. feeling loved again. 

16. What song will always remind you of 2004?
'i'm locked up... won't let me out...'

17. Compared to this time last year, are you:
a) happier or sadder? both.
b) thinner or fatter? uhhh... not thin. never will be. but i think i may have lost some.
c) richer or poorer? poorer.

18. What do you wish you'd done more of?
enjoyed life more. seen my family and friends more. loved myself more. 

19. What do you wish you'd done less of?
forgiving people. ignoring reality. believing people.

20. How will you be spending Christmas?
with my family. and i am SOOOOOO thankful for that.

21. There is no question 21
did you lose it or something? did it run away?

22. Did you fall in love in 2004?
fell out of love, mostly... 

23. How many one-night stands?
none.

24. What was your favorite TV program?
raymond. 

25. Do you hate anyone now that you didn't hate this time last year?
no. 

26. What was the best book you read? 
i dunno. read a few good ones, tho. 

27. What was your greatest musical discovery?
yes.

28. What did you want and get?
time with family and friends. a new job.

29. What did you want and not get?
a vacation.

30. What was your favorite film of this year?
oh my... i havent been to the movies in SOOOOOO long.... i can't even remember what move popcorn tastes like... last time i went to the movies was mid-august. 

31. What did you do on your birthday, and how old were you?
uhm... shan, krista, des, and jon had me over for poker and cake. and kat and bob and kelley came over to my house and we drank a lot, too. i turned 23.

32.What one thing would have made your year immeasurably more satisfying?
yes. 

33. How would you describe your personal fashion concept in 2004?
stripes, stripes, and more stripes.

34. What kept you sane?
love of friends and family, and prayer.

35. Which celebrity/public figure did you fancy the most?
ewan. still. and angelina. still.

36. What political issue stirred you the most?
haha. yer funny. politics don't 'stir' me. 

37. Who did you miss?
everyone and everything. especially those people and things i took for granted. 

38. Who was the best new person you met?
lola. 

39. Tell us a valuable life lesson you learned in 2004:
'homicide isn't for amateurs anymore.'

You are 93% Pisces
How much do you match your zodiac sign?

three things i am wearing right now:
1. scrubs.
2. socks.
3. watch.

1. subwoofer.
2. empty diet pepsi cans.
3. chapstick.

three things i want to do before i die:
1. find peace.
2. travel more.
3. think of more things to do before i die.

three good ways to describe my personality:
1. fun.
2. loving.
3. helpful.

three bad things about my personality:
1. low self image.
2. too trusting.
3. too forgiving.

three things i like about my body:
1. my eyes.
2. my lips.
3. my hair, most of the time.

three things i dont like about my body:
1. my butt
2. my feet.
3. and my boobs.

three things most people don't know about me:
1. until i was 18, i couln't blow my nose.
2. i wear size 11-12 (mens) shoes.
3. something else that i don't even know yet.

three things i say the most:
1. d00d.
2. ugh.
3. yep.

three places i want to go:
1. my happy place.
2. to bed.
3. and somewhere it's not so hot.

three names i go by:
1. Stacey.
2. Stac.
3. Hey you.

three screen names i've had:
1. tika.
2. kahlan304.
3. WeirdOne. (if handles count, too.)

three foods i love:
1. peanut butter cups.
2. jack in the box tacos.
3. ramen.

three favorite hangouts:
1. my couch.
2. my bed.
3. in front of my computer.

three alcoholic drinks i like:
1. captain n' coke.
2. anything cheap thats not beer.
3. anything free thats not beer.

three things i ate last:
1. salisbury steak tv dinner.
2. granola bar.
3. sliced peach.

three obsessions:
1. clean hands.
2. movies.
3. rum.

three regrets:
i don't have regrets. everything happens for a reason. and everything that happens has a lesson that can be learned from it. if i claim something was a regret, then i'd never be able to accept the decision made and learn from the situation.

i got the envelope in the mail today giving me my results on my certification exam. i was terrified to open it, but i managed to talk myself into it, anyways. i was totally sure i failed both the state and national exams, and completely and utterly shocked when i saw i had passed both. so shocked, that i even cried when i saw it. now, i'm just shaky and have butterflies in my stomach. i still can't believe that i passed both the exams. i keep looking at the letter and rereading it thinking i was wrong when i read it the first time. (and the second.. and third... and fourth. you get what i'm saying.) i keep thinking that theres some sort of illusory type enchantment on the letter and that the next time i look at it i'll see smoke come across it and the letters will all rearrange to confirm that i am indeed, a failure. but it hasn't so far. i think i'll save this letter. since i'm so excited about it. and as proof in case later on i receive another one telling me it was a mistake or something. :P
i have to send off a check to pay for the certificate to be issued. i'm really excited about the whole thing in general. what a great thing to wake up from a nap and find out. :)
*dance*

You are:
Quiz created with MemeGen!

In 1981 (the year you were born)
Ronald Reagan becomes president of the US

Minutes after Ronald Reagan becomes president, Iran releases 52 American hostages that had been held captive for 444 days

President Reagan is shot in the chest by would be assassin John Hinkley

Space shuttle Columbia, the world's first reusable spacecraft, is sent into space

A suspended walkway in the Kansas City Hyatt Regency Hotel collapses, killing 113

A female former lover files a "palimony" suit against tennis star Billie Jean King

President Reagan appoints Sandra Day O'Connor to be the first woman on the Supreme Court

The Pac-Man video game is introduced in the US

Alicia Keys, Elijah Wood, Kelly Rowland, Anna Kournikova, and Britney Spears are born

Los Angeles Dodgers win the World Series

Oakland Raiders win Superbowl XV

New York Islanders win the Stanley Cup

Raiders of the Lost Ark is the top grossing film

"Bette Davis Eyes" by Kim Carnes spends the most time at the top of the US charts

MTV debuts on cable television, playing music videos 24 hours a day

Gimme a Break premieres

I dunno how true it is, but here it is.

"You are a WEDF--Wacky Emotional Destructive Follower. This makes you a menace to society, depending on how you channel your energies. You chew your fingers and have an addictive personality. Properly guided, you can be enormously productive--otherwise you run amok, stir up trouble, and generally have a hell of a good time.

To your friends, you are a source of relentless entertainment. You often get into trouble, but you almost always find a way out. You are strangely popular and feed off others' energy. You live hard, seize the day, and although your more sober friends would like to see you settled down, you generally have fewer regrets and better memories than they do. Your tenet is that, at the end of the day, one regrets only what one didn't try. You are right.

You could benefit from outside help in balancing your highs and lows. Or perhaps cutting back on the caffeine."
although you can't tell by his photos, he's dark gray w/ lighter gray swirlies. i present to you, the kitten known as mr. blink:
HAPPY SEISO DE CINCO TO ALL AND TO ALL A GOOD NIGHT!

it's said that you can tell if a dog will survive parvo by what their progress is on the fourth day of treatment. if they make it through that far and are getting slightly better, they're good to go. :)
day 2 is going well so far. i'm very pleased with how well punky is doing. she even got to eat some tonight. shes fighting off the nasty bugs well and seems to be doing great. if she holds down her tiny dinner overnight tonight she may be able to come home tomorrow!
*happy dance*
i'm still sick. congested and swollen and sniffly. but i'm on nyquil. so i'll live.

its too soon for this. i'm not ready to lose another pet. maybe i'm just not meant to have a new dog. maybe punky was meant for someone else. maybe she just isnt meant to be. at all. it isnt fair. i vaccinate my dogs. i take every precaution against diseases and viruses. i've secluded her from the outside world.
i have no clue. i'm so sick feeling right now. i woke up feeling like i just came down with a head cold or tonsil infection or something and this day just hasnt got any better.
i wanna start over. i wanna wake up. i dont like this dream. i wanna start over.
i dont wanna go into the office to take care of her again tonight. i'm terrified i'll find her lifeless body there. i'm so scared she wont live through this. its such an ugly ugly disease. and we're only at the beginning.
at least we got it early, right?
blah.

i totally should be sleeping right now.
i've not felt well today. feeling kinda blah all over. oh, and pumping myself full of cranberry juice (thanks, mom!) in order to try and stave off what seems to be an upcoming kidney infection or kidney stone. :(
i have to work early in the morning, but i can't seem to get myself to fall asleep. there's neet movies on my cable tv. its amazing what a payment to the cable company can fix.
i was really glad to see ivy, chris, and the two cutest nieces in the world yesterday. it was also really nice to hang out with them for a bit, even though ivy was all doped up from her eye surgery that day. i was especially glad to see brooke and sierra. brooke is talking now! and ohsovery cute! and sierra is just hillarious. very fun to be around.
nothing else really exciting is going on. a few friends are coming over tomorrow night after i'm offa werk. thats neet.
they fired someone at my work, and two other people finished out their final days with us this week also. its been really crazy. and its only going to get worse from here.
thats all for now. this weekend's goal = numbness.

i'm updating because jen told me to. :) i don't know how long this will be because i don't really have much to say. and i wanna go to bed. i'm really tired. it has been a long day.
my little brother was admitted to the hospital today. they think he has an abscess behind his tonsil. his tonsil is so inflamed, it's almost completely covering his trachea. they've got him on iv fluids and antibiotics and are going to decide if it needs surgery tomorrow. he has been feeling pretty shitty since yesterday, having trouble swallowing, a sore throat and fever ranging between 102 and 103. when it continued today, mom set him up an appt with his physician. when he was at the dr's office they told my dad to take him to the ER because of the severity of his condition. last i heard the children's ward was full so they put him in a room on the adult floor and are waiting to see what happens with him tomorrow. so yeah...
bo has been really good. no acting out, no peeing in the house. (she was having a real problem with that before and i'm wondering if she didn't do it because she wanted more attention...) i've been leaving her at the 'rents house when i'm gone, to give her time to be with other dogs. i know she misses amber. i can see it in her eyes. she looks around sometimes and looks for her, too. the 'rents say she totally freaks out and cries and whines and acts like a nut (like way worse than normal. to the extent that the first time it happened, they thought something might've been wrong with her. well, physically wrong. not mentally. we already know she's crazy.) when she sees that i've come home. it almost seems like she thinks i'm abandoning her every time i leave her there. maybe she thinks i abandoned amber somewhere, too. i don't know. either way, she's excited to go there every morning, and i'm glad for her to have company while i'm gone.
i got amber's ashes back from the crematorium on friday. the urn is very nice. very tasteful. it almost doesn't even look like an urn. just like a thick portrait frame. i'm happy with it, but i still have yet to take her urn out of the box and put it somewhere i want to keep it. as of this moment, the cardboard box containing her cremains resides on my coffee table, waiting for me to set it up elsewhere. i think keeping it beside my bed is a good idea. a few people suggested it to me, as it was her place to sleep. and it seems fitting since she's now sleeping. i don't want to put her there on the dirty dusty nightstand. i need to clean it off, throw some old water bottles and soda cans away, and wipe it down first.
the cremation service people came today to our office to do their weekly pickup. i did pretty well not being upset until i went outside and saw their pickup with the bed full of colored bags. it just broke my heart thinking about amber having been in there.
for the most part, i think i'm doing okay. i'm not hysterical. i'm not as unpredictable emotionally. but i still cry a few times a day, and i still miss her like hell. my heart aches to hold her again. to smell her, touch her soft fur and tell her how very much she means to me. but i'm comforted to know she's at peace. and that she doesn't have to hurt anymore. i think having her ashes home now is helping me a lot, too. i was really upset having her away from me. and even though i KNOW that its just ashes in that little box, its her. part of my baby. and i felt like i was disrespecting her and abandoning her by her not being here with me. i know it sounds stupid. and i know her spirit isn't in the little box. but thats just how i feel about it.
i was talking to a friend the other day and telling her how amber used to cry when i left for school when i was a kid. in the most recent years, she's always just slept in her bed in the living room near the front door until i came home. that really clicked with me after we talked about it. i know she's just sleeping now. sleeping until i come home and we can be together again.
i cant think of anything else to talk about, really. i had a weird work day. it was almost like i was there but i wasn't. came home and make a few steaks over at the 'rents place. now i'm here. and i think its my bed time.

i had a nice day today. i didn't cry as mucha s ai thought i would. i did break down a few times though. 
someone who loves me very much snuggled with me and checked on me a buncha times to make sure i was okay.
someone who loves me very much treated me to a pedicure and dinner. it was beautiful. and the food was good too. :)
someone else who loves me very much listened to me cry and whine and try to sort through feelings i have about decisions to come and gave me good advice and comforting words.

even though i'm a hysterical crying sobbing mess, in a way, i feel comforted.
i know this was the right decision.

i wish when i say i am cranky you would know it means i need to be papmpered and coddled by you.
i wish you knew when i say i want to spend time with you it means i wanna snuggle. with you. a lot.
i wish you could tell when i'm frustrated, and stop when i ask you to.
i wish i could be sane and rational and not be so emotional.
i wish i dinnit feel like my insides hate me.
i wish i could say what i want and feel without crying.
i wish you knew what i needed and felt without me having to cry.

its official. adkins and i were never meant to be. i never did try the fad diet due to its bad reputation for people that get kidney stones, but now its official that i never will try it.
santa brought me a bread machine for christmas.  i've been wanting one for a long time now. i tried the new toy out today. it was a beautiful thing.
bottom line: carbs own me.

today was stressful at work. after i got through my rough day, i spent time swimming in the 'rents pool with my niece sierra. 
while swimming with her, after pretending our hands were various sea creatures, she said the sweetest, cutest thing i've ever heard come from a child's mouth. (see below.)
'when i get older, can i take care of amber for you when you go away to visit people?'
'amber probably won't be around then. she has an appointment to go to doggie heaven.'
'where is doggie heaven?'
'well, it's right next door to people heaven.'
'why does she have to go there?'
'when animals get sick and old thats where they go. that's just the way it is. you remember grandma's dog lady, right?'
'yeah.'
'she's in doggie heaven. she got sick and thats where she went.'
'i want to see lady.'
'we can't see her. she's in doggie heaven.'
'well... if we look really hard through the clouds, i bet we could see her feet.'
'yeah. let's try...'

i'm on an emotional roller coaster. i cried in the car listening to music on the radio. i cried when watching stupid movies on cable today. i'm frustrated about upcoming plans with my family and cried about that too. so many things are changing but staying the same. and i'm acting as if my world is crumbling but it's not.
i don't know what i'm feeling yet i try to describe it. i don't know why i'm feeling yet i'm trying to change it. i'm confused and insanely rational all in the same moment. and i just want to be held.
please hold me tight against you. and whisper in my ear that it'll all be okay.

pretty much everything i have to say has already been said. mexico was beautiful. the concert was awesome. i really enjoyed the time away with friends. i purchased the limited edition dvd 'viva la paz' and the movie-length dvd 'long ride home. i was pleasantly surprised when watching 'viva la paz' to see that the first two songs were recorded at the mexico show last october. a good percentage of the videos, you can see our little group of friends, off the the side, and theres a decent shot of the back of my head.
supahstahh!!!!!

the matrix reloaded was all i ever hoped it would be. and it pleases me to know that i profited from the movie experience.
that just means i have to go again.

they're showing old wallace & ladmo episodes on tv now every night around 8pm. i figure if i watch enough times i'm bound to see myself on there. my sisters and i were on the wallace and ladmo show several times. i almost got a ladmo bag once. i traded seats with my friend stacy, because i wanted to sit next to someone else. the seat i was originally sitting in got picked for a ladmo bag. i was so irritated that i didn't get that ladmo bag. i'd always wanted one. that was just the coolest thing back then. from then on, i never switched seats. i always sat in my assigned seat. lotta good it did me though. i've still never won anything.

who was the first person to look at a cow and say,  "i think i'll squeeze these dangly things here, and drink whatever comes out"?

who was the first one who thought that the white thing that came from a chicken's ass looked edible?

why do toasters always have a setting that burns the toast to a horrible crisp which no self respecting human being would eat?

why is there a light in the fridge and not in the freezer?

if jimmy cracks corn and no one cares, why is there a song about him doing it?

can a hearse carrying a corpse drive in the carpool lane?

if the professor on gilligan's island can make a radio out of a coconut, why can't he fix a hole in a boat?

why do people point to their wrist when asking for the time, but don't point to their crotch when they ask where the bathroom is?

why does the ob-gyn leave the room when you get undressed if they are going to look in between your legs anyway?

why is goofy bipedal while pluto remains on all fours?

what do you call male ballerinas?

why are trix only for kids?

if wile e. coyote had enough money to buy all that acme crap, why didn't he just buy dinner or hire a hitman?

why is a person that handles your money called a broker?

if quizzes are quizzical, what are tests?

if corn oil is made from corn, and vegetable oil is made from vegetables, then what is baby oil made from?

if a man is talking in the forest, and no woman is there to hear him, is he still wrong?

if electricity comes from electrons, does morality come from morons?

did you know that the alphabet song and twinkle, twinkle little star have the same tune? 

(are you singing them both to right now find out?)

did you ever notice that when you blow in a dog's face, he gets mad at you, but when you take him on a car ride, he sticks his head out the window?

why is it that when someone tells you that there are over a billion stars in the universe, you believe them, but if they tell you there is wet paint somewhere, you have to touch it to make sure?

i feel like shit. and yet, even as i realize this, i feel like i don't know how or what to feel anymore. it just doesn't seem worth it to try anymore.
my head is so very puffy and hurtful. i just want to crawl into my bed and hibernate until everythings okay and theres no more hurt.
please listen carefully because i only want to say this once. i'm not saying it to try and get attention or sympathy. it just seems so much easier to type it out then to call everyone and update them over the phone. i don't want to keep telling the story over and over again. it only makes me more upset and makes my eyes hurt more. as it is now, it feels as though someone shoved their envelope openers into my eyes and proceeded to pour lemon juice down the long blade. please know that although i appreciate your sympathy and condolences, right now talking about it and hearing those words make me hurt more. i'm just not ready to accept it all yet. once it's all okay in my head, i'll be able to talk about it. i think it's just going to take some time for me to work through my thoughts on it.
i took molly mcnoodle to the ultrasound specialist today. it was as we had feared. she was in the final stages of kidney failure. her kidneys were so small, that it was near impossible for the specialist to even recognize them. but alas, he's the best, and thats why i went to him. he assumed from her appearance, age, blood results and condition that she had some sort of congenital defect making her kidneys smaller in size and more prone to inefficiency. then she got into something that caused them to shrink even smaller in size and stop functioning. he said normally if this was the beginning of it, he would recommend treatment with antibiotics, steroids, and fluid therapy. then recheck her blood work and see how it looks in a few days. since we've done all that, and the blood work was only showing her kidneys to be worse. he then recommended taking her home to say goodbye and then taking her into work in the morning to end it.  i came home, sobbing the whole way, and talked to matt between hysterical bawling. if left in this condition she would inevitably die. and it would only get more painful throughout the night. the only option i was okay with was taking her into work and ending it now.
so here i am... one hour after she looked up into my eyes for the last time and cuddled up against my face almost as if reassuring me of my decision. i kissed her on her head, told her i loved her, would miss her, and that she'd be all better soon. then she sighed in relief.
god i miss her. so very much.

this is the part where i have a whole lot to say and reflect upon. too bad i don't, huh?
it will only get more interesting from here on out.

one bright day in the middle of the night,
two dead boys went out to fight.
back to back they faced each other,
drew their swords and shot each other.
a deaf policeman heard the noise,
and came and got those two dead boys.
if you don't believe my tale is true,
ask the blind man, he saw it too.
'oh i see,' said the blind man,
as he picked up his hammer and saw.

i'm tired of this.
i'm tired of crying.
